meanings.definition: The outer layer of cells in a blastula.
meanings.sent1: During development, the ectoblast forms the outer protective layer.
meanings.sent2: The ectoblast is crucial for the structure of the blastula.
meanings.sent3: The ectoblast decided to throw a party on the surface of the blastula.
meanings.sent4: Like a shield, the ectoblast shields the inner cells of the blastula.
meanings.sent5: The ectoblast, like a fortress wall, guards the inner cells of the blastula.

meanings.definition: A cell layer in the early embryo that gives rise to the epidermis and nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The ectoblast is responsible for forming the skin and nerves in the embryo.
meanings.sent2: In the early stages, the ectoblast starts developing into the epidermis and nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The ectoblast in the embryo decided to become a superhero and protect the skin and nerves.
meanings.sent4: Just like a seed grows into a tree, the ectoblast grows into the epidermis and nervous system.
meanings.sent5: The ectoblast, like a master builder, constructs the epidermis and nervous system in the embryo.
